Actions to promote the use of iron supplementation in pregnant women
In settings where anaemia in pregnant women is a severe public health problem (40% or higher), 
a daily dose of 60 mg of elemental iron is preferred over a lower dose.
If a woman is diagnosed with anaemia at any time during pregnancy, she should be given daily iron 
(120 mg of elemental iron) and folic acid (400 Î¼g or 0.4 mg) until her haemoglobin concentration
